explanations.A: The negative values still make working out the range possible, but we have to be careful with signs: 46 − (−3) = 46 + 3 = 49. The question is more concerned with why a value of 49 as an answer isn't particularly representative of the data. Can you think why this might be?
explanations.B: Repeated values still make working out the range possible: 46 − (−3) = 46 + 3 = 49. The question is more concerned with why a value of 49 as an answer isn't particularly representative of the data. Can you think why this might be?
explanations.C: The number of pieces of data still make working out the range possible: 46 − (−3) = 46 + 3 = 49. The question is more concerned with why a value of 49 as an answer isn't particularly representative of the data. Can you think why this might be?
explanations.D: The value of 46 is an outlier. An outlier is a value in a data set that is very different from the other values, and as a result, calculating the range using 46 could be misleading.

explanations.A: The median of a set of numbers is the middle value, which means that just the position of the other numbers is used, but their values are ignored.
explanations.B: Outliers would distort the mean, but have little effect on the median.
explanations.C: The median can be used with both positive and negative numbers.
explanations.D: In this case you would find the mean of the two middle values.

explanations.A: In this case you would find the median of the two middle values.
explanations.B: When finding the median, the values of the other pieces of data are ignored. The mean takes the value of every piece of data into account.
explanations.C: The mean can be influenced by outliers, so in this situation the median is the best option
explanations.D: When data is non numeric you can't find the mean or the median, so neither would be appropriate.
